Which should have been the end for because now that the entire family line was gone there was nobody to worship our believe in her causing her to fade away... Until the final chapter is showed she came back but was forced to wonder and atone for what she did... The sad part is she ended up meeting a man on her Exodus and he had been the first man in a long long time this is still the Modern Age who actually treated her nicely started to care for her as they journey to each Buddhist temple as she told him her story. Till the end where he tried to absolve her of her sins telling her that was the past and she's atoned enough... But only assuring she failed her atonement what with completely reminding her of her first love and now making her believe that this time she can make it work the whole stupidity she did before of being the singular female line of his bloodline! Basically had she remained alone she might have atoned too bad

Or better to say. Her obsession especially since in her Obsession to assure each new generation head would always end up with her by isolating them, one of the stories ending with the guy losing his childhood friend love interest when he wished the fox girl would get rid of said girl abusive father which ended poorly not only cementing that the people in the village that already hated his family were right about them cursing them oh, but more importantly put it in the girl's mind because even if he wasn't abusive ass-whole he was still her father and she wanted nothing to do with him afterwards. He stayed with the fox woman but he made it clear he despised her for the rest of his days, and it was shown he was not the first nor last descendant to despise her. The last one in the Modern Age being so badly affected by the inbreeding his final days were pretty much beating and raping her and well insulting her until he ended up dying from an early age aneurysm.
